bullets.text: FAA to cut flights at 40 airports amid shutdown, risking delays and airline revenue hits.
Court orders administration to fully fund SNAP this month, averting immediate food aid shortfalls during shutdown.
Fed issues enforcement actions against Belt Valley Bank and The Halstead Bank, underscoring ongoing supervisory pressure on smaller lenders.
Tesla shareholders approve Elon Musk’s $1 trillion pay plan; payout hinges on future performance and legal challenges.
Global equities pressured as AI-linked stocks slide; Microsoft extends losing streak, SoftBank drops, Asia markets track declines.
OpenAI projects $20B ARR and $1.4T data center commitments, signaling unprecedented AI infrastructure spending needs.
Report says Meta derived ~10% of 2024 revenue from scam and fraud ads, heightening regulatory and reputational risks.
Ford reportedly weighing end of all-electric F-150 Lightning, signaling EV demand and profitability headwinds.
Google to buy carbon credits from massive Amazon reforestation project, bolstering voluntary carbon markets and corporate decarbonization strategies.
U.S. job cuts hit highest October level in 22 years, signaling rising labor market slack.
Starlink surpasses 8 million customers, wins more spectrum and airline deals, expanding satellite broadband’s competitive footprint.
Airbnb beats revenue and raises outlook as travel demand holds, but rising costs may pressure margins.
White House touts obesity drug pricing deals lowering monthly costs to ~$149; coverage details unclear, creating uncertainty for Eli Lilly and Novo.
U.S. deploys attack aircraft to El Salvador as Congress blocks ban on striking Venezuela, escalating regional security tensions.
Scientists warn parts of Antarctica’s ice sheet collapse may be unstoppable, implying multi-meter sea-level rise risk over coming centuries.
